oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from British War Office to Lt. Roy A. Douglass
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Lt. Roy A. Douglass served as a doctor with British Army with the 1 Battn., 5th Manchester Regt. and was awarded the Military Cross for gallantry by the British Army, the second highest award given to foreigners during the World War I. During heavy shell fire, he left shelter at great personal risk to attend wounded soldiers, saving many lives. He survived the war and worked as doctor in Huntingdon, Tenn. upon his return. [See also GWjack179, GWjack180.]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
